seriesStmt.title: František Ignác Antonín Tůma: A thematic catalogue of his works

annot.p: da capo of the first 42 bars

Messa della morte | a 4 voci | 2 violini | e | 2 Tromboni | in conc: | con | Rip:ni e clarini col | surdino ad lib:tum | Partes 36. | Requiem e Kyrie . | Del sg: Franceſco Tuma | Maestro di Cap:a di S: Maesta | Ces: L'Imp:ce Elis: Vedova | L'Anno 1742

[below, dark brown ink:] 20 decemb apud capuc: pro Imperatrice

[bottom, pencil:] 16934. 55 Blt. 20 Auflagstimmen

physMedium.p: Three sets of parts in three wrappers, comprising (1) the Sequentia (20 parts), (2) the Offertorium (22 parts), as well as (3) the Sanctus, Benedictus, and Agnus Dei (22 parts), respectively.

annot.p:
Sequentia: S solo (5), A solo (5), T solo (6), B solo (5), S coro (4), A coro (4), T coro (4), B coro (4), cnto (4), fag (4), clno 1 (2), clno 2 (2), trb 1 (6), trb 2 (4), vl 1 (5), vl 2 (5), vlc (7), vlne (7), org (7), mdc (7)
Offertorium: A solo (4), T solo (2), S coro (2x; 2, 2), A coro (2x; 2, 2), T coro (2x; 2, 2), B coro (2x, 2, 2), cnto (2), fag (2), trb 1 (2), trb 2 (2), vl 1 (2x; 3, 3), vl 2 (2x; 3, 3), vlc (2), vlne (2), org (3), mdc (3)
Sanctus to Agnus Dei: S solo (4), A solo (4), T solo (4), B solo (4), S coro (3), A coro (3), T coro (3), B coro (3), cnto (2), fag (2), clno 1 (2), clno 2 (2), trb 1 (3), trb 2 (3), vl 1 (2x; 4, 4), vl 2 (2x; 4, 4), vlc (4), vlne (4), org (4), mdc (4)

These movements have been archived under a shelfmark with an Introitus and Kyrie by Georg Reutter the Younger. Thus, they have been attributed to the latter (see P. Norbert Hofer’s edition in Denkmäler der Tonkunst in Österreich, vol. 88 (1952), and his catalogue of Reutter’s works, entry 46/4).
A copy by Joseph Leysser and copyist A.

titlePage.label: [wrapper]
titlePage.p: Messa | della morte | a | 4 voci concert: | Due Violini concerti: | Due Tromboni concerti: Due Clarini con Sordini Oblig: | Tympano con Sordini | Con | Organo e Violone | Del Signore Francesco Thuma | M: D. C. della Imperat: Elisabeth: vedova

annot.p: S solo and coro, A solo and coro, T solo and coro, B solo and coro, clno 1, clno 2, trb 1, trb 2, timp, vl 1, vl 2, vlne, and org
